metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1959 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
lib/x509/verify.c in GnuTLS before 3.1.21 and 3.2.x before 3.2.11 treatsversion 1 X.509 certificates as intermediate CAs, which allows remoteattackers to bypass intended restrictions by leveraging a X.509 V1certificate from a trusted CA to issue new certificates.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
guile-gnutls - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls-deb0-28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.11-2ubuntu1').
